intro: Cousinia kermanshahensis, commonly known as the Kermanshah cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought resistance through its succulent foliage. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in mountainous regions of western Iran. Cousinia kermanshahensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
